Issues are the backbone of **project organization** in collaborative platforms.

## What you'll learn:
- **Tracking** - How to create and manage issues

- **Labels** - Categorizing and filtering

| **Task Management** | Assign and track work |

slides.title: Issue Templates
slides.content:
# Issue Templates ðŸ“‹

Standardize issue quality across your project.

## Bug Report Template

Create `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md`:

```markdown
---
name: Bug Report
about: Create a report to help us improve
title: '[BUG] '
labels: 'bug, needs-triage'
assignees: ''
---

## Description
A clear and concise description of the bug.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '...'
3. Scroll down to '...'
4. See error

## Expected Behavior
What you expected to happen.

## Actual Behavior
What actually happened.

## Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots.

## Environment
- OS: [e.g., macOS 14.0]
- Browser: [e.g., Chrome 120]
- Version: [e.g., 2.1.0]

## Additional Context
Any other relevant information.
```

## Feature Request Template

```markdown
---
name: Feature Request
about: Suggest an idea for this project
title: '[FEATURE] '
labels: 'enhancement'
---

## Problem Statement
Describe the problem this feature would solve.

## Proposed Solution
Describe your proposed solution.

## Alternatives Considered
Other solutions you've considered.

## Additional Context
Any other relevant information.
```

slides.title: Bug Reports
slides.content:
# Writing Great Bug Reports ðŸ›

## Essential Elements

### 1. Summary
```
Bad:  "App crashes"
Good: "App crashes when uploading files larger than 10MB"
```

### 2. Steps to Reproduce
```markdown
1. Navigate to the upload page
2. Select a file larger than 10MB
3. Click "Upload" button
4. Observe the crash
```

### 3. Expected vs Actual
```markdown
**Expected:** File uploads successfully with progress bar
**Actual:** Application crashes with error code 500
```

### 4. Environment Details
```markdown
- **Browser:** Chrome 120.0.6099.71
- **OS:** macOS Sonoma 14.2
- **App Version:** 2.3.1
- **Device:** MacBook Pro M2
```

### 5. Evidence
```markdown
**Console Error:**
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'size' of undefined
    at FileUploader.js:42
```

**Screenshot:** [Attached]
```

## Bug Severity Levels

| Level | Description | Example |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| **Critical** | System unusable | Data loss, security breach |
| **High** | Major feature broken | Login fails |
| **Medium** | Feature impaired | Slow performance |
| **Low** | Minor issue | Typo in UI |

# Milestone Best Practices ðŸ“Š

## Planning with Milestones

### Version-Based Planning

```
â”œâ”€â”€ Core features

v2.0 - Major Update
â”œâ”€â”€ New architecture
â”œâ”€â”€ Additional platforms
â””â”€â”€ Premium features
```

### Sprint-Based Planning
```
Sprint 23 (Jan 8-22)
â”œâ”€â”€ User Story 1 â†’ Issues #101, #102
â”œâ”€â”€ User Story 2 â†’ Issue #103
â””â”€â”€ Technical Debt â†’ Issues #95, #98

Sprint 24 (Jan 22 - Feb 5)
â”œâ”€â”€ User Story 3 â†’ Issues #104, #105
â””â”€â”€ Bug Fixes â†’ Issues #99, #100
```

## Tracking Progress

| Metric | What to Watch |
|--------|---------------|
| **Burndown** | Issues closed over time |
| **Velocity** | Issues per milestone |
| **Carryover** | Issues moved to next milestone |
| **Scope Creep** | New issues added mid-milestone |

## Closing Milestones

1. Review all issues
2. Move incomplete to next milestone
3. Update release notes
4. Close the milestone

> ðŸŽ¯ **Pro Tip:** Don't add issues after milestone starts!

## Scoped Labels (GitLab)

## Managing Labels

```yaml
# .github/labels.yml

- name: enhancement
  color: a2eeef
  description: New feature request
```

## State Descriptions

| State | Meaning |
|-------|--------|

| **Triaged** | Reviewed, prioritized |
| **Active** | Assigned, ready to work |

| **Blocked** | Waiting on dependency |
| **Closed** | Completed or resolved |
| **Won't Fix** | Decided not to address |

slides.title: Linking and References
slides.content:
# Linking Issues ðŸ”—

Connect related work for traceability.

## Issue References

### Basic Reference
```
See also #123
Related to #456
```

### Cross-Repository Reference
```
See organization/other-repo#789
```

### Closing Keywords
```
Closes #123
Fixes #456
Resolves #789
```

When PR is merged, issue is automatically closed!

## PR to Issue Links

```markdown
## Summary
This PR implements the user authentication feature.

## Related Issues
- Closes #123 (Main feature issue)
- Fixes #456 (Related bug)
- Related to #789 (Won't fully address)
```

slides.title: Automation
slides.content:
# Issue Automation ðŸ¤–

Automate repetitive issue management tasks.

## GitHub Actions Automation

### Auto-Label Based on Path

```yaml
# .github/workflows/labeler.yml
name: Labeler
on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened]

jobs:
  label:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/labeler@v4
        with:
          repo-token: "${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
```

### Auto-Close Stale Issues

```yaml
# .github/workflows/stale.yml
name: Stale Issues
on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily

jobs:
  stale:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/stale@v8
        with:
          stale-issue-message: 'This issue is stale due to inactivity.'
          stale-issue-label: 'stale'
          days-before-stale: 60
          days-before-close: 7
```

## Project Automation

### Built-in Rules
```
When issue is opened â†’ Add to project
When PR is merged â†’ Move to Done
When label is added â†’ Move to column
```

> ðŸ¤– **Tip:** Automation saves time and ensures consistency!

slides.title: Searching and Filtering
slides.content:
# Finding Issues ðŸ”

Efficiently search through issues and PRs.

## Basic Filters

```
is:issue              Show issues only
is:open               Open items
is:closed             Closed items
is:pr                 Pull requests only
```

## Label Filters

```
label:bug             Has bug label
label:"help wanted"   Labels with spaces
-label:bug            Does NOT have bug label
```

## Assignee and Author

```
assignee:username     Assigned to user
assignee:@me          Assigned to me
author:username       Created by user
no:assignee           Unassigned issues
```

## Date Filters

```
created:>2024-01-01   Created after date
updated:<2024-01-01   Updated before date
closed:2024-01-01     Closed on date
```

## Combined Searches

```
is:issue is:open label:bug assignee:@me
is:issue milestone:"v2.0" sort:updated-desc
is:pr is:open review-requested:@me
```

## Saved Searches

Bookmark common queries:
```
/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug
```

> ðŸ’¡ **Tip:** Learn search syntax to find issues quickly!
